item.title: It’s the middle of an interview, and I keep messaging you.
item.description: It’s the middle of an interview, and I keep messaging you. It’s nice, you know, to be able to share stuff. An Instagram reel of a cat overreaching, or bizarre things like a program requiring us to work ungodly hours. I want to immediately share with you. Or even nonsense because I want to see a notification saying ‘qt’ has messaged me back. It’s comfortable, like a being wrapped in a warm blanket while watching a movie at night, or listening to soft music as we drive into nothing.

item.title: We’re on a run and I’m feeling in love with you.
item.description: We’re on a run and I feel weightless. Well, actually I’m in a lot of pain now, but just a few minutes ago, I felt like I could run forever. For as long as we had things to talk about, I could keep putting one step in front of another. And how could we not? Our favorite thing to do together is literally to do nothing, or anything together. Now though, the miles are catching up, and I need to concentrate to run.

item.title: You’ve fallen asleep on my arm and I’m feeling in love with you
item.description: You’ve fallen asleep on my arm and I’m feeling in love with you Sometimes, in the comfort of thoughts formed half asleep, and get lost in thoughts haves and wants. Me? I want your quiet love. The love that’s there, and steady. The love of you falling asleep, curled into my chest, your body relaxing into mine. Your love, having remembered to set an alarm for a call early tomorrow, and mine, timing my breathing to match your movements.

item.title: We’re running around in a stone forest and I’m in a better mood when you’re around
item.description: We’re running around in a stone forest and I’m in a better mood when you’re around. No seriously, I feel like half the time we’re just being, I have an ear to ear grin and I want to hug and squeeze you and go grocery shopping. But today, we’re dancing along to a Taekwondo song, galavanting through a hike, with the nature around us all etched stone. We’re racing around and exploring what we can see, being as loud as we are until we remember to be quiet.

item.title: About
item.description: Illustration from Victor Hugo et son temps (1881) The Hunchback of Notre-Dame (French: Notre-Dame de Paris) is a French Romantic/Gothic novel by Victor Hugo, published in 1831. The original French title refers to Notre Dame Cathedral, on which the story is centered. English translator Frederic Shoberl named the novel The Hunchback of Notre Dame in 1833 because at the time, Gothic novels were more popular than Romance novels in England.
